intro: Yoania pingbianensis, commonly known as the Pingbian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and is adapted to cool, moist environments. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
